# showsFPS

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the view displays a frame rate indicator.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var showsFPS: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

The frame rate is a good indicator of the performance of your scene. Avoid creating scenes that have widely varying frame rates.

## Enabling Visual Statistics for Debugging

- **showsNodeCount**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view displays an overlay that shows physics bodies that are visible in the scene.
- **showsDrawCount**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view displays the number of drawing passes it needed to render the view.
- **showsQuadCount**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view displays the number of rectangles used to render the scene.
- **showsPhysics**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view displays physics-related debugging information.
- **showsFields**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view displays information about physics fields in the scene.
